Description

This is a presskit for a game developed by two graduate students from American University. The Butcher, the Mobster, the Gumshoe, and His Chauffeur is a 2D side-scrolling text-adventure noir, starring the most unlikely of heroes: the chauffeur. The game is all about exploration and evasion: Use your wits to solve puzzles and access areas deeper into the butcher’s den, and evade the mobster goons while you’re at it.

History

Worlds Collide

When Kyle Mitchell and Che Rose couldn't settle on a single idea for a development project, this game was born. A mash-up between a text adventure and a side scroller, this noir-themed romp through crime and betrayal puts the player in the shoes of a chauffeur who has been tasked with driving a detective to a shady part of town in order to investigate some disturbance. But we don't want to spoil everything. So, without further ado, the lead-in to our game.

Lead-In

It’s almost 2 in the goddamn morning. The sign on the butcher shop says “CLOSED” but the lights are still on. You give a heavy sigh. It’s always the same with these detective-types. They’re constantly badgering you where you to go, and when to be there, and not to be late so-help-me-God, and when you finally do show up--they’re nowhere to be found. The damn gumshoe’s gone missing, or worse--got himself killed. On top of that, no one can know you and this asshole detective were here, so it’s up to you to go and fish him out. And you’re just the damn driver.

Features

Throwback to the text adventures of yore, like Zork! Puzzles that will have you checking every corner of every room. Combat that only includes running away from enemies. Noir-themed art style. A gripping plot that will keep you wanting to play...
